Market Notice: Fatty Acid Analyses of Arctic Marine Plankton and Fish Samples
======================================================================

### Overview

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) intends to award a contract for the analysis of fatty acids in marine plankton and fish samples from the Arctic region. Suppliers interested in providing these services can submit a statement of capabilities.

### Description of Requirements

DFO requires a contractor to analyze particulate organic matter from the water column, zooplankton, and fish species for fatty acids using standard elemental protocols. The analyses will provide results for lipid classes and fatty acid methyl esters for each sample. The contractor will be responsible for:

* Analyzing up to 400 samples per year
* Providing final data for lipid classes, fatty acid methyl esters, and summary totals for fatty acid methyl ester groups
* Processing and analyzing samples according to established protocols for fatty acid analyses of Arctic water samples

### Criteria for Evaluation of Statement of Capabilities

Suppliers must demonstrate the following requirements:

* A minimum of 10 years of experience in running lipid classes and fatty acid analyses
* A reputation of excellence in lipid class and fatty acid analyses, documented by over 160 peer-reviewed publications using established analytical methods
* A history of providing lipid class and fatty acid analyses results to government agencies
* Documented experience running lipid class and fatty acid analyses on plankton samples at trace levels, with a minimum laboratory detection limit of 5 ng

### Trade Agreements and Limited Tendering Reason

This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP). The exception to the Government Contracts Regulations is invoked under subsection 6(d) - only one person is capable of performing the work.

### Contract Details

* Period: 1 year, from contract award to March 31, 2023, with an option to extend for 2 one-year periods
* Estimated value: $229,500.00 (GST/HST included)
* Pre-identified supplier: Memorial University of Newfoundland

### How to Submit a Statement of Capabilities

Suppliers can submit a statement of capabilities in writing to Pascal Busungu, Contracting Officer, no later than December 15, 2022, at 2:00 p.m. AST. Inquiries and statements of capabilities should be directed to DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca.
